paper_abstract: Permanental polynomials are computed for all fullerenes C-<= 50(that includes 812 isomers). Properties of their coefficients and zeroes are investigated statistically using the data obtained. New properties are found, and exceptions are also discovered comparing with the results by Cash through the data of C-<= 36 (that includes 35 isomers). More linear patterns of zero clusters can be identified as some smaller fullerenes are ignored.
paper_title: Permanental polynomials of the larger fullerenes
